data.name: Javascript
data.description: I have nearly 2 years of experience working with JS, and am strong in ES6 syntax.

data.name: Python
data.description: I am solid in Python, have been using it for server-side code at my Wave coop, as well as in interview prep

data.name: PHP
data.description: I have used server side PHP and in Wordpress customization. It's a nice language and I enjoy working with it.

data.name: C#
data.description: I group C# and Java in the same OOP bucket. I grew up learning these languages and they'll always have my heart, but I am a bit rusty with them.

data.name: ReactJS
data.description: I have been using ReactJS for a few months but feel that I have a really good grasp. I've used functional components with hooks, and have watched lots of talks about how it renders internally, to gain a deeper understanding.

data.name: Django
data.description: I've used Django for server-side logic at my Wave coop. Using typed Python 3.X, I really have come to respect it as a versatile backend framework. We used the CQRS event sourcing pattern, which I'm a big fan of.

data.name: Laravel
data.description: I worked with Laravel and PropelORM at my Calian coop, and got quite solid with this. PHP is a multi-purpose language that is powerful when weilded correctly in this environment.

data.name: ExtJS
data.description: ExtJS is a lesser known frontend framework that I used at my Calian coop. It uses MVC architecture, which may not be cutting edge anymore, but still taught me important patterns and optimizations.

data.name: REST
data.description: I am quite experienced with REST. I've had the opportunity to dig deep into the networking, exploring batching and optimizations.

data.name: GraphQL
data.description: GraphQL is really cool and I've gotten to use it a bunch. I've written resolvers for queries, and defined schema as well as tests.

data.name: gRPC
data.description: gRPC is a super neat way method of data exchange that I've gotten to use during my time at Wave. It gives predictable results and nice standardizations.

data.name: Protobuf
data.description: Using gRPC necessitates pb, so I've gotten the opportunity to define plenty of messages, mappers and transformers.

data.name: Docker
data.description: I've used Docker to create my own microservices, as well as manage orchestration of an ecosystem of services with docker-compose.

data.name: Logging
data.description: This is newer to me, but I've been able to build out Datadog dashboards, trace bugs with Sentry and debug problems with Sumo Logic.

data.name: Testing
data.description: I have spent a lot of time testing different frameworks, be it Jest for React, Pytest for Django, SenchaTest (built on Jasmine) for ExtJS.

data.name: CD/CI
data.description: On the CD front: I've found my way around Jenkins for deploymments, and CircleCI for creating various testing steps in pipelines. I've also used Gitlab CI, which is quite similar to Circle.
